sentences.sContent: He said sometimes they would invite some friends to share the happiness of Thanksgiving Day.
sentences.sContent_eng: He said sometimes they would invite some friends to share the happiness of Thanksgiving Day.
sentences.sCn: 他说有时候他们也会邀请一些朋友来一起分享感恩节快乐。

sentences.sContent: I hear about these people every Thanksgiving, then never think about them again for the next 364 days.
sentences.sContent_eng: I hear about these people every Thanksgiving, then never think about them again for the next 364 days.
sentences.sCn: 我在每个感恩节都听说过这群人，而后在接下来的364天，就再也没有想起过他们。

sentences.sContent: It compares with "Cyber Monday" in the US - the day after Thanksgiving marketed as a big online shopping day.
sentences.sContent_eng: It compares with "Cyber Monday" in the US - the day after Thanksgiving marketed as a big online shopping day.
sentences.sCn: 它与“网络星期一”在美国，感恩节后的第一天销售作为一个大型网上购物一天。

sentences.sContent: ...which is similar to the custom of celebrating Thanksgiving in North America...

remMethod.val: thanks(感谢) ＋ giving(给予) → 感谢上帝的给予 → 感恩节

trans.tranOther: a public holiday in the US and in Canada when families have a large meal together to celebrate and be thankful for food, health, families etc
